org.redpin.server.standalone.db.homes
Class EntityHome<T extends IEntity<java.lang.Integer>>

java.lang.Object
  org.redpin.server.standalone.db.homes.EntityHome<T>
Type Parameters:
T - entity which implements the interface IEntity
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEntityHome<T,java.lang.Integer>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BluetoothReadingHome, FingerprintHome, GSMReadingHome, LocationHome, MapHome, MeasurementHome, VectorHome, WiFiReadingHome
public abstract class EntityHome<T extends IEntity<java.lang.Integer>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements IEntityHome<T,java.lang.Integer>

Abstract class which provides an partial implementation of all function needed to add, get, update and remove entities to/from database

Author:
Pascal Brogle (broglep@student.ethz.ch)

executeUpdate

protected boolean executeUpdate(java.lang.String sql)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
This function is intended to be used for DELETE commands, because it does not return the generated key

Parameters:
sql - SQL command (DELETE) to be executed
Returns:
true if at least one row has been changed
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

executeUpdate

protected java.sql.ResultSet executeUpdate(java.lang.String sql,
                                           java.lang.Object[] data)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
This function is intended to be used for INSERT and UPDATE commands where the generated key is needed

Parameters:
sql - SQL command (INSERT, UPDATE) to be executed
data - Array of data do be used in the SQL command
Returns:
ResultSet with generated key
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
